It seems to me this would involve studying children to determine conw
parison effects, other than pure retention of subject matter, when they are
presented a certain segment of information in written form as compared to
other forms such as TV and radio.
Physiology and psychology â€” what goes on inside the subject when he
reads that is different than what goes on while he is viewing TV for example.
This is something new for me, and difficult to put into words and may-
not be at all what McLuhan has in mind. But, if it is what he has in mind,
something might be put together using some of the observations I have
expressed above^: that would be a little easier to comprehend than what McLuhan
has said - or this may be worthy only of the trashcan.
General Reactions:
McLuhan, from the tone of his letter, seems to feel hurt and left out
of other activities (non-NAEB). To me, tying with stag lines, series, of
beys, etc., is carrying linear concept to the ridiculous.
